content:
Do you have 2 smtp servers defined in Account Settings, with the same settings except for User Name (email address), and is account 1 sending on smtp 1, and account 2 sending on smtp 2? Select the account in the left pane of Account Settings and look at Outgoing Server (SMTP) in the right pane to see if the User Names match.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593
creator: sfhowes

creator: sfhowes

content:
Je pravdepodobné, že máte narušený profil Thunderbirdu. Vytvorte si NOVÝ PROFIL Thunderbirdu ako test pre kontrolu, či váš súčasný profil nie je príčinou tohoto problému. Na vytvorenie nového profilu môžete použiť odkazy v ponuke Štart - Spustiť (alebo iba WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek a preverte, či problém pretrváva. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete vrátiť k pôvodnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p

http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/20/Thunderbird_novy_profil.jpg

Ak je problém odstránený, potom pokračujte v tvorbe (budovaní) NOVÉHO PROFILU Thunderbirdu. Nakoniec môžete ten STARÝ profil odstrániť.
creator: Ansamb

content: Uvedený odkaz vůbec nevysvětluje ani jeden z problémů, na který jsem poukázal.

content: Dobrý den, hlavní problém je v tom, že po každé údržbě složek se samo změní nastavení seřazení e-mailů "Podle vláken", i když jsem předtím nastavoval "Bez vláken". Ale i s tou četností údržby mi to přijde divné: V nastaveních jsem měl 200 MB a nevěřím, že by po smazání 10 až 20 e-mailů, většinou bez příloh a s maximální přílohou 5 MB se uvolnilo 200 MB, a to i s uvážením, že by se e-maily kódovaly 2 Byte na 1 Byte. Zdraví Svatopluk Sedláček
creator: ssedlacek

content: That is not a good idea to have a tiny cloud with a down arrow to represent 'get messages'. If you must minimise everything surely the word 'Get' would be more indicative of what it does. Not everyone uses 'the cloud' and many have poor eyesight making such a small symbol difficult to see and interpret. Thanks for the quick response.
creator: johnbl

content: That button checks for mail on the highlighted account only. The 'get message' button available for unified toolbar checks for all.
creator: davidsk

content:
Install the new version to a separate folder, then don't launch it at the end of setup. Start the new version with Profile Manager from the Run window (Winkey+R):

C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird new\thunderbird.exe -p or similar path

Uncheck 'Use the selected profile...'. Create a new profile, name it, then launch new TB in the new profile.

When you launch TB 17, the Profile Manager will appear where you can select the old profile, if it isn't autoselected.

Once you have the new profile running, it's probably more convenient to copy the local mail (mbox files in the old profile) to Mail/Local Folders in the new profile for easy access.
creator: sfhowes

content: I've just moved two junk emails into Local Folders Junk and set delete older than one day. One has a date of today and one has an older date. So I'll have to wait a short while to see if test works. If all goes as expected they should disappear tomorrow.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
On reflection, it occurred to me that transferring an email to a Junk folder might not in itself be a sufficient condition for the email to be considered as junk.

I've modified the filter to add another, initial, condition to 'Set junk status to junk' prior to moving to the junk folder. This has indeed flagged them all as junk. But closing and restarting TB has not removed the older ones. So I suppose these emails all have a hidden flag somewhere indicating the date at which they were declared junk since TB is not taking into account the emails' 'Date'.

Looks like I'll have to wait to see if they get trashed after 21 more days.

It does seem a pity that moving emails to junk is not a sufficient condition to declare their status as junk.

Can anyone confirm that this idea is correct?
creator: philip-jackson

content: That row of icons is fixed, focusing on reading and sharing the email, not storing it. The unified toolbar seems the best bet.

content:
The unread counts in the Folder Pane can be hidden or styled:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1426787#answer-1611024

The height of the lines in the message list can be changed with the Density control (click the 3-bar AppMenu), or with this method:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1423577

To negate 'hopping on delete', there is an add-on.

Making these changes is far easier than trying to revert to the previous version.
creator: sfhowes

content: Cookies must be accepted in TB Settings/Privacy & Security to allow OAuth2 authentication to store a token in Saved Passwords. Accept cookies for at least login.live.com in Exceptions. Same applies for other providers that apply OAuth2, such as gmail, AOL and Yahoo.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Have you tried restarting Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode?

Try this: In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshoot Mode
  • click on 'Restart'

Select checkboxes:

  • Disable all addons
  • Reset toolbars and controls
  • click on 'Make changes and Restart'

Report on results.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: The first thing to try is the Font Size and Density controls on the 3-bar AppMenu. To make more detailed adjustments, see https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1427253

content:
Se parli della password principale, non si può recuperare. Si può resettare ma nome utente e password di accesso dei vari account andranno reinseriti nuovamente -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/password-principale-thunderbird

Se parli della password di un account, quello non dipende da Thunderbird ma dal fornitore dell'account che di solito ha una sua procedura per il recupero.

content: Make sure cookies are allowed in Thunderbird.
creator: christ1

content: It is more likely your antivirus is doing something wrong. Most antivirus products that implement mail scanning (something I consider a waste of time) issue self signed encryption certificates which are not trusted by Thunderbird. Most of these companies have instruction on how to manually add their untrusted certificates to the Thunderbird store. But you in doing so vouvh for the validity of the certificate, something Thunderbird can not verify because the certificates are not in the chain of trust TLS relies upon.
creator: MattAuSupport
